intro: Peucedanum fauriei, commonly known as Chinese cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender stems and fern-like, finely divided leaves that are often covered in a fine pubescence. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Peucedanum fauriei is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional Chinese medicine.
